nodes.bodyText: Do we need specific gradle versions here? Let's use whatever the gradle plugin project is using instead.
I will remove gradle wrapper related files from test resources directory. They were created when I tested this project manually.

I think you should remove this, since our CI will be also testing it under Java 11. And I remember we had issues with Kotlin and Java 14. If you run into that, the tests may need to be disabled for that version.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,42 @@
+buildscript {
+
+    repositories {
+        jcenter()
+        mavenLocal()
+        mavenCentral()
+        gradlePluginPortal()
+    }
+
+}
+
+plugins {
+    java
+}
+
+group = "com.quarkus.demo"
+version = "1.0"
+
+
+subprojects {
+
+    apply(plugin = "java")
+
+    java {
+        sourceCompatibility = JavaVersion.VERSION_1_8
+        targetCompatibility = JavaVersion.VERSION_1_8

nodes.bodyText: Good idea. I will change this.
This seem to be only Kotlin compatible no?

This part should be fine for Groovy and Kotlin DSL (property names are same), but this still will not work since AbstractGroovyGradleBuildFile and AbstractKotlinGradleBuildFile will surround this string with ' and ". Not sure why integration tests didn't catch that. I will fix this.

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -72,6 +72,8 @@ private void generateProjectRunTests(String buildtool, String language, List<Str
                 .addData(getTestInputData(Collections.singletonMap("artifact-id", name)))
                 .addCodestarts(codestarts)
                 .putData("buildtool.name", buildtool)
+                // for JVM 8 and 14 this will generate project with java 1.8, for JVM 11 project with java 11
